posts.post_content:
[Damnation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damnation) is an absurdly wonderful card, let's get that out of the way. the thing is R&D will *probably* never reprint it in a Standard environment.  
  
I think [Barter in Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Barter in Blood) is more on par with Magic's power level that they are trying to transition into. Flavor fully and mechanically "sacrifice matters" these days.  
  
I like seeing black get card advantage.  
  
I am delighted to see this come into the meta :D
posts.html:
Damnation is an absurdly wonderful card, let's get that out of the way. the thing is R&D will probably never reprint it in a Standard environment.

I think Barter in Blood is more on par with Magic's power level that they are trying to transition into. Flavor fully and mechanically "sacrifice matters" these days.

I like seeing black get card advantage.

I am delighted to see this come into the meta :D

Posted By: majinara (4/27/2012 12:06:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @Timmyforever - This actually can generate card advantage, where diabolic edict never will. If you cast this with an empty board and nab two creatures, you just effectively +1'ed your opponent. Of course, it's going to be crappy if you're playing an aggressive deck too. The card really shines in a control deck that can take advantage and make the symmetrical effect asymmetrical.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
oof, am I happy about the new art!  
  
The last one was some kind of massacre against [Cobalt Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cobalt Golem) (not sure why, though).  
  
This one has Sorin goin' all Gran Torino on them Vamp's, saying, "GET THE F\*\*K OUT OF MY NEIGHBORHOOD!".  
  
4/5 for some great EDH action.  
  
EDIT: I know why [Cobalt Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cobalt Golem) is being sacrificed... and I don't blame them (First Barter in Blood from Mirrodin set) :S

Posted By: Tivadercrusader (5/12/2012 6:03:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not always the best, but in the right deck, this is just downright vicious. No, this won't go in every aggro deck you make. But there is a time and a place for this card, and if you know when that is, you can make this sucker *sing*.  
  
(The time and place, by the way, is usually in a control deck, or after a few careful chump-blocks in limited that leave you with nothing and the other guy with nothing but one or two of his big threats)
posts.html:
Not always the best, but in the right deck, this is just downright vicious. No, this won't go in every aggro deck you make. But there is a time and a place for this card, and if you know when that is, you can make this sucker sing.

(The time and place, by the way, is usually in a control deck, or after a few careful chump-blocks in limited that leave you with nothing and the other guy with nothing but one or two of his big threats)

Posted By: TherealphatMatt (5/20/2012 8:05:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
i use 4 copies in my demon tribal deck.  
turn 1+2- do nothing  
turn 3- [soulcage fiend](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=soulcage fiend)  
turn 4- attack with soulcage, barter in blood  
turn 5- [bloodgift demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=bloodgift demon)  
rarely fails. throw in a coulple of [Homicidal Seclusion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Homicidal Seclusion)s for the win.
